Package com.jalapeno

Main package for InterSystems Jalapeño Technology.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Adaptor Copyright (c) 2008 InterSystems, Corp.
ExtentManager Provides interface to manage database extent and perfrom such operations as kill extent, rebuild indices and populate extent with test data.
ObjectManager API defintion for storing and operating with POJOs in database.
ObjectManagerFactory API for creating and managing connections to the database.
Utilities Provides interface to perfrom some additional operations on POJOs such as serialize objects to XML and deserialize them back.
 

Class Summary
ApplicationContext Implements different connection options to connect to database and obtain an instance of ObjectManager.
Settings Interface to configure ObjectManager Settings, including Fetch Policy, Access Policy, Client Cache Type, default ClassLoader.
 

Package com.jalapeno Description

Main package for InterSystems Jalapeño Technology.

InterSystems Jalapeño (JAva LAnguage PErsistence with NO mapping) technology provides a way for Java developers to rapidly build database applications. It automatically derives persistent Caché classes from Java data class definitions.

Jalapeño lets Java programmers define data classes and build applications within their favorite Java development environments and not be concerned with the mechanics of how their data objects will be stored. They can develop using objectoriented techniques, and, because their data is persisted in Caché, still query it using SQL via JDBC.

At runtime, Jalapeño provides the mechanisms needed for Java classes to interact – via either object or relational access – with their data housed in Caché’s powerful multidimensional database.

InterSystems Support
